com.magnet.android.async

Class GeoStore

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.magnet.android.async.GeoStore

  • public class GeoStore
extends Object
    This class is used by GeoConstraint, WifiAndGeoConstraint, and MobileAndGeoConstraint to access the geo-fences stored in the default store. The store name used by these constraints is DEFAULT_STORE.

    Here is a typical usage: 

     GeoStore store = GeoStore.getInstance(context, GeoStore.DEFAULT_STORE);
 store.load();  // load any existing geo-fences
 GeofenceEntry[] entries = new GeofenceEntry[] { new GeofenceEntry(...) };
 store.add(entries, true);  // add a new entry
 ...

      Persistent entry for geofence.

      • DEFAULT_STORE

        public static final String DEFAULT_STORE
        The geo-store name used by the geo-constraints.

    • Method Detail

      • getAllInstances

        public static List<GeoStore> getAllInstances(android.content.Context context)
        Get all instances of persisted stores. This method has a side effect that The stores in the list will be connecting to the Google Play Service.
        Returns:

      • getInstance

        public static GeoStore getInstance(android.content.Context context,
                   String storeName)
        Get an instance of a store with a unique name. The store will be connecting to the Google Play Service. The caller should check if the store is connected successfully to Google Play Service by calling isReady() or waitForReady(long).
        Parameters:
        context -
        storeName - A store name with alphanumerics.
        Returns:

      • removeInstance

        public static void removeInstance(String storeName)
        Disconnect the store from the Google Play Service.
        Parameters:
        storeName - A store name with alphanumerics.

      • matchGeofence

        public GeoStore.GeofenceEntry matchGeofence(android.location.Address location)
        Find the first geo-fence that matches the specified location.
        Parameters:
        location - A location with longitude and latitude.
        Returns:
        A GeofenceEntry or null if there is no match.

      • isReady

        public boolean isReady()
        Check if this store is ready to manage the geo-fences.
        Returns:

      • waitForReady

        public void waitForReady(long timeout)
        Wait until the store is ready to manage the geo-fences.
        Parameters:
        timeout - Timeout in milliseconds.

      • getCurrentLocation

        public android.location.Address getCurrentLocation()
        Get the best most recent location currently available after the fences were set up #setUpFences(GeoStore).
        Returns:
        An Address object with lat/lng, or null if not available.

      • createMyLocation

        public GeoStore.GeofenceEntry createMyLocation(String id,
                                      float radius,
                                      long duration,
                                      boolean in)
        Create "my location" entry based on the current location.
        Parameters:
        id - The name of this entry.
        radius - Radius in meters.
        duration -
        in - true for inside the fence; false for outside the fence.
        Returns:
        null if current location is not available
        See Also:
        getCurrentLocation(), isReady()

      • getEntries

        public Collection<GeoStore.GeofenceEntry> getEntries()
        Get the entries from the storage.
        Returns:
        A collection of GeofenceEntries, or an empty collection.

      • get

        public GeoStore.GeofenceEntry get(String id)
        Get the entry by its ID.
        Parameters:
        id - The ID of an entry.
        Returns:
        A GeofenceEntry object or null.

      • exists

        public boolean exists()
        Check if the store exists.
        Returns:

      • clear

        public void clear()
        Clear the geo-fence store, remove the cached entries and tear down all associated geo-fences.
        Throws:
        RuntimeException - The Google Play Service is not ready yet.

      • load

        public List<GeoStore.GeofenceEntry> load()
        Load the geo-fence entries from a file and cache them in memory. Any previously activated geo-fences remain unchanged. Entries can be added or removed by calling add(GeofenceEntry[], boolean) or remove(String[], boolean).
        Returns:
        A list of geo-fence entries.

      • add

        public boolean add(GeoStore.GeofenceEntry[] entries,
          boolean saveNow)
        Resolve the geo-locations from the postal addresses (if possible) and persist them optionally. If any elements are null, they will be ignored. The newly added geo-locations are activated immediately.
        Parameters:
        entries -
        saveNow - true to persist immediately.
        See Also:
        isReady()

      • remove

        public boolean remove(String[] ids,
             boolean saveNow)
        Remove the entries from the persisted storage and deactivate the geo-fence of the removed entries.
        Parameters:
        ids -
        saveNow -
        See Also:
        isReady()

      • toString

        public String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class Object
